etymology.description: Phonetic: 攸(攸) (yōu) + Semantic: 彡(彡) (shān, "ornament") -> 修(修) (xiū, "repair")
etymology.interpretation: The character 修(修) (xiū, "repair") combines 攸(攸) (yōu, serving a phonetic purpose) and 彡(彡) (shān, suggesting ornamentation or embellishment), to depict the idea of fixing or enhancing something, which aligns with the concept of repair.

examples.chinese: 他正在修桌子(他正在修桌子)。
小明修花园里的围栏(小明修花園裡的圍欄)，让家更温馨(讓家更溫馨)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo Míng xiū huāyuán lǐ de wéilán, ràng jiā gèng wēnxīn.
examples.english: Xiaoming repairs the garden fence, making the home cozier.
